boardgame.name: God_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s Playground
boardgame.description: The game is set in Poland and draws heavily from the book by Norman Davies. It covers the period from about 1400 to 1790, which is covered by vol 1 of the two books._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each player represents a Polish magnate. There are various ways of scoring victory points, owning land, religious activity, winning battles, etc. Surrounding Poland are her numerous enemies, who may or may not decide to attack Poland. It is up to the players how well they defend the country. The way the enemies work is that they change their strength to match historical changes._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve Been Diced! episode 30: The games that got away
I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve Been Diced! episode 31: Three player games
I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve Been Diced! episode 39: Martin Wallace

NOT THE GAME. This is an additional set of player counters so you can play a 4-player game. This set is not wooden, but rather printed on paper (black picture on white background), laminated, and mounted onto black mat board. Get yourself a bunch of cubes (e.g., natural color) to use for the black enemies (Swedes, Prussia, etc.). Give the black cubes included in the game, and this set of counters, to the 4th player. Rules for 4er game can be found in the files area of [gameid=57998]. Free shipping in US.
